scenes.heading: EXT. DAY
scenes.actionPreview: Ingrid arrives in a taxi. She rings the bell. The door opens and she goes inside. It’s a building with personality, sober and with good taste. 2 3 . BUILDING WASHINGTON SQUARE. MARTHA’S APARTMENT. INT. DAY Ingrid goes along the corridor, or up some stairs, looking at the different doors. She’s carry

scenes.heading: INT. DAY

dialogues.text: And I brought you a couple of books.
Thank you… You want something to drink?
Are you working on something new?
I’ve never been able to allow myself that…
The mere idea of it gives me chills.
Are you sure this is the right way?
We can’t let them down now, señora.
Five years… Do you remember Liberia?
How do you know the Carmelite?
What a group! I so admire their freedom.
I know… it struck me too.
Do you think I’m fated too?
Maybe it will work this time!
What are you doing up, Martha?
(To the nurse) Can you help her?
I just want some peace and quiet.
It’s late… I should be going…
No… I want to talk to you about something.
I will not go out in mortifying anguish.
I’m hoping/I hope you’ll say yes.
To my asking you to help me.
I think we should go get our seats…
Do you know where you want to do it?
Are you completely sure you’re ready?
Hi, I’ve made up my mind.
And, even so, you’re going with Martha?
Have you told her we’re in touch?
She rates you pretty highly as a lover.
Where are you? Are you at home ?
Good… Have you decided where we’re going?
(She thinks it’s a lot) A month? !
You’re going to need a lawyer.
(Dubious) Yes… I should look for one.
CAR DRIVES ALONG SOME ROADS. EXT. DAY
Do you hear them?! How wonderful!
Do you mind if I take this one?
No! Of course not. It’s your house.
I can hear you breathe… And yell.
Okay, then I’ll unpack my things.
No, not tomorrow. We have to go now!
Don’t worry. I’ll help you find it.
(Much calmer) Where did you find it?
What a great place to return to.
I don’t remember you telling me that.
But I’m not going to do it.
Is there anything you want me to get?
Do you want to come to the store with me?
No. I’m just in town for a little bit.
Okay… I’ll use one of your trainers then.
I live with a friend who’s dying…
Do you want to buy it ?
Don’t be so hard on yourself.
THE STREET. EXT. DAY. NEW ENGLAND
Are you still in touch with him?
(Lying) I mean… from time to time.
If you’re too tired, I can read
I can only listen to the birds singing.
What are you doing up? What’s wrong?
Your door was closed. I thought you…
I threw up. Oh my God.
IS EARLY MORNING. HOUSE IN THE WOODS. INT.
Yes. It’s daytime. And you’re alive.
Before coming out here I made a new will.
Let’s not talk about this now.
Of course you can read them.
THE MORNING. INGRID’S STUDY. INT. DAY
Be careful, it’s a little chilly…
Have you talked to your trainer about me?
Remember you know nothing about anything.
Come here, give me a kiss.
I lied to her. And I don’t like it.
(With a smile) Yes, I remember that…
No…. Tell me about your lecture.
I’ve always admired you for that…
Do you think it will be much longer?
No, it’ll be soon. Any day now…
I do have one. I’ve thought about it.
FOLLOWING IS AN ALTERNATIVE I WOULD LIKE TO TRY:
What did you do the night before?
What did you do the following morning?
What do you want to do?
Do you want to see your mother’s room?
Did she tell you about me?
So, she told you about my father?
Of course! This is your mother’s house.
I came out to listen to the birds…

scenes.actionPreview: Ingrid looks with curiosity at the interior of the apartment and makes some comments. She recognizes some of the objects that hark back to a time when they saw each other daily. Ingrid gives Martha some flowers. Martha gratefully takes them. to the flowers) These are for you… Ingrid follows Martha i
